Name: Protests of agency procurement decisions
Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to protests of agency procurement decisions

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts

Summary: This bill would require the Procurement Policy Board to promulgate rules allowing vendors and their designated representatives to protest procurement decisions made by a city agency.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Paragraphs 8 and 9 of subdivision b of section 311 of the New York city charter, paragraph 8 as amended by local law number 169 for the year 2023 and paragraph 9 as amended by local law number 20 for the year 2004 and redesignated by local law number 129 for the year 2005, are amended, and a new paragraph 10 is added to such subdivision b, to read as follows:
      8. rules relating to the making of small purchases in a manner that will advance the purposes of the program for minority- and women-owned business enterprises and emerging business enterprises established pursuant to subdivision b of section thirteen hundred four; [and]
      9. [such other rules as are required by this chapter.] rules authorizing the submission of a protest by a vendor or a vendor's designated representative of a determination of any procurement action by an agency; and
      10. such other rules as are required by this chapter.
      ï¿½ 2. This local law takes effect 120 days after it becomes law.
